The chunk introduces a "GeomParticleRenderer" page within a GUI, enabling users to input a geometry node for particle rendering. It complements existing force configurations by focusing on visual representation settings, fitting into a section dedicated to renderer configuration or as another tab in the notebook interface.

############################################################################
# GEOM PARTICLE RENDERER PAGE  #
############################################################################

The chunk adds a new page within a GUI framework, specifically configuring the GeomParticleRenderer for particle systems. It allows users to input a geometry node via an entry field, enhancing the visual aspect of particle rendering by specifying which geometric model to use. This section is part of setting up how particles are visually represented in simulations or animations.

 geomPage  = self.rendererNotebook.add('GeomParticleRenderer')
 f  = tk.Frame(geomPage)
 f.pack(fill=tk.X)

 # Geom Node input field
 tk.Label(f, width=12, text='Geom Node', pady=3).pack(side=tk.LEFT)
 self.rendererGeomNode = tk.StringVar()
 self.rendererGeomNodeEntry = tk.Entry(f, width=12,
                                       textvariable=self.rendererGeomNode)
 self(renderer_geom_node_entry.bind('<Return>', self.setRendererGeomNode))
 self.rendererGeomNodeEntry.pack(side=tk.LEFT, expand=1, fill=tk.X)

 ############################################################################

############################################################################
        # GEOM PARTICLE RENDERER PAGE #
        ############################################################################
        geomPage = self.rendererNotebook.add('GeomParticleRenderer')
        f = tk.Frame(geomPage)
        f.pack(fill = tk.X)

        # Geom Node input field
        tk.Label(f, width = 12, text = 'Geom Node', pady = 3).pack(side = tk.LEFT)
        self.rendererGeomNode = tk.StringVar()
        self.rendererGeomNodeEntry = tk.Entry(f, width = 12,
                                              textvariable = self.rendererGeomNode)
        self.rendererGeomNodeEntry.bind('<Return>', self.setRendererGeomNode)
        self.rendererGeomNodeEntry.pack(side = tk.LEFT, expand = 1, fill = tk.X)
